articles.title: Kim Jong Un Autographs Letters from Officials and Other  Working People and Students
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Autographs Letters from Officials and Other  Working People and Students 
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un autographed letters officials and other working people, teachers and students sent to him, reflecting their determination to be single-mindedly loyal to the party, enshrining deep in their hearts the loving care and trust of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					 Kim Jong Un sent his autograph to the teachers and cadets of Kim Jong Il University of People's Security after reading the letter they sent to him after having the highest privilege and honor of erecting the statue of the great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il in the university campus on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 After reading a letter from the employees of the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex, he sent his autograph on July 24, 2013, reposing his trust in the workers of the complex.
					
					 On the same day he autographed the letter from the art group members of Changsong County, the North Phyongan Province, calling on them to let the songs of struggle, happiness and victory resound more loudly in the county which has turned into a socialist paradise under the leadership of the party.
					
					 He also sent his autograph to the officials and employees of Rungna Dolphinarium, pleased to learn that dolphins please people with their improved skills, after reading their letter.
					
					 He autographed on July 24, 2013 a letter from the members of the party cell of workteam No. 1 of the production shop of the Pyongyang Taesong Tyre Factory, expressing  hope to see the party cell emerge a steel-strong one which firmly preserves the bloodline between the party and the people.
					
					 He sent his autograph to the players and coaches of the Hwaebul Football Team (Group A) under the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League on July 24, 2013 and August 14, 2013 after reading the two letters they sent to him. He urged them to be unquenchable Hwaebul (Torch) in giving rise to the hot wind of football across the country and wished them greater successes in their future matches.
					
					 He sent his autograph on August 14, 2013 to the players and coaches who took part in the Women's Football Championship for 2013 East Asian Cup after reading their letter. He hoped that they would be the strongest and ever-victorious women players in the world.
					
					 On July 24, 2013, he sent his autograph to Jang Un Bi, tractor driver of the Mechanized Workteam of the Hungso Co-op Farm in Hamju County, the South Hamgyong Province after reading Jang's letter. The supreme leader reposed trust in Jang, an indication of the great all-embracing politics of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 He autographed on August 14, 2013 a letter from Yu Byol Mi, student of a school under the Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory of Russia. He encouraged her to study harder to become a famous musician. He also autographed on the same day the letter sent by Kim Yu Jin, student of the Nampho Foreign Languages School, He wrote he would wait for a medium-length real story titled "Children in the Era of Songun" to be written by the student.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Martyrs Cemeteries, Graves
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Martyrs Cemeteries, Graves
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery and the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery on Sept. 19 (Harvest Moon Day).
					 Seen standing on wreath-laying stands of the cemeteries were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior party, state and army officials, vice-premiers of the Cabinet, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's bodies, ministries and national institutions and men and officers of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and citizens.
					
					 Wreaths were laid on the wreath-laying stands of the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK and on the wreath-laying stand  "Soul of Heroes" of the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the DPRK National Defence Commission .
					
					 Wreaths also were placed in the name of armed forces organs, social bodies, ministries, national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and education, public health and media institutions as well as party and power bodies and industrial establishments and farms here.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of those martyrs who remained intensely loyal to the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and glorified their noble life in the struggle to liberate the country, achieve its prosperity and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Wreaths were laid before statues of martyrs, cemeteries of martyrs, memorial towers of fallen fighters of the Korean People's Army and their graves in Hyesan, Wonsan, Chongjin, Haeju and other places on the occasion.
					
					 Wreaths and bunches of flowers were also placed in the name of provincial party and power organs and working people's bodies, industrial establishments, farms and schools.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Graves of Grandparents and Parents of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Graves of Grandparents and Parents of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the graves of President Kim Il Sung's grandparents Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik and his parents Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok in Mangyongdae on Thursday, Harvest Moon Day.
					 Seen before the graves were the wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Yong Nam, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yang Gon, Mun Kyong Dok, Jo Yon Jun, and officials of party and power organs and working people's bodies and ministries and national institutions and Pyongyangites.
					
					 Placed before the graves were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK and the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 Also laid before the graves were wreaths in the name of working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, educational institutions, party and power organs and farms, etc. here.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to the ardent patriots, looking back on their revolutionary careers.

articles.title: CPRK Secretariat Slams S. Korean DM's Anti-DPRK Remarks
articles.content:
CPRK Secretariat Slams S. Korean DM's Anti-DPRK Remarks
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Traitor Kim Kwan Jin, Defense minister of south Korea at a "defense policy briefing" in Inchon on September 15 said the "north plans the fourth generation war envisaging disrupting society through cyber warfare, media warfare and terrorism in collusion with the forces following the north", alleging that the plotted rebellion of the Unified Progressive Party can be viewed as preparations for it.
					 He also termed the measure taken by the DPRK on its own initiative to improve the north-south ties a "tactical dialogue offensive to get rid of difficult situation".
					
					 At the plenary meeting of the national defense committee of the puppet National Assembly, the meeting of army commanders and the "Seoul international military symposium" that were held earlier the traitor made such coarse invectives that the "north's nukes can never be tolerated", "there is precedence of the north making provocations when the dialogue was under way" and the "north will get nothing from nuke, missile and provocation".
					
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) in the information bulletin No. 1041 on Wednesday termed this an anachronistic act going against the trend of the times toward improvement of the north-south ties and detente, and an unpardonable mockery and challenge to the DPRK making sincere efforts for national reconciliation and reunification.
					
					 The bulletin branded the traitor as a die-hard pro-U.S. flunkey and trigger-happy hooligan who inflamed war frenzy against the north, plunged the north-south ties into deadlock and created the worst danger of war on the Korean Peninsula while acting as a henchman executing the U.S. strategy to dominate Asia and a shock brigade in carrying out the puppet regime's anti-DPRK policy.
					
					 The traitor is repeating provocative remarks against the DPRK. This is aimed to convert the detente being created on the Korean Peninsula to tensions and confrontation, being displeased with the new dialogue phase opening up in the north-south relations.
					
					 The situation proves that as long as such die-hard confrontational maniacs as Kim Kwan Jin lord it over in south Korea, the north-south ties can not improve as expected by the nation but the situation will get strained on the peninsula.
					
					 However, the present south Korean authorities are slandering the good faith, magnanimity and will for dialogue and peace shown by the fellow countrymen and blatantly challenging them. They are speaking loudly of "trust-building process on the Korean Peninsula" while shielding Kim Kwan Jin and other traitors. This can not but be viewed as hypocrisy and deception to mislead the public opinion.
					
					 The DPRK already warned that the Korean nation will suffer in case the south Korean regime allows the traitor to stay in office as defense minister.
					
					 In order to make fresh progress in the north-south relations and bring peace and stability to the peninsula, it is essential to remove such leftovers of the era like Kim Kwan Jin who is inviting disaster.
					
					 The DPRK will make all possible efforts for the improvement of the north-south ties and the national reconciliation and peace. But it will never pardon the group of traitors who are making provocations while making a mockery of the dignity of the DPRK. 
					
					 Those who go reckless against the trend of the times will never be able to evade stern punishment by the nation.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from King of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Abdullah Ⅱ, king of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, on September 8.
					 The king said in the message that he was pleased to extend sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the government and people of Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He sincerely wished the DPRK and its people steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Senegal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Senegal 
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Macky Sall, president of the Republic of Senegal, on September 12.
					 The president said that he deemed it great honor to extend the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the national day of the DPRK.
					
					 He wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Un happiness and the fraternal Korean people prosperity on behalf of the government of Senegal and its people.
					
					 He reaffirmed his will to join Kim Jong Un in making positive efforts to boost the cooperative relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indonesian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indonesian President
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, president of the Republic of Indonesia, on September 10.
					 The president said in the message that he was pleased to extend the warmest congratulations and salute to Kim Jong Un and the government of the DPRK and its people on behalf of the government of Indonesia and its people, on the occasion of the birthday of the DPRK which falls on Sep. 9.
					
					 He reiterated his firm resolution to make efforts to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Belarusian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Belarusian President 
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Aleksandr Lukashenko, president of the Republic of Belarus, on September 9.
					 The president in the message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK on behalf of the Belarusian people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed his conviction that the invariable efforts of Belarus and the DPRK to develop the mutually beneficial relations between the two countries would contribute to boosting the bilateral cooperation in different fields in the future, too.
					
					 The president paid highest regard to Kim Jong Un, wishing him and his families good health and happiness and the people of the DPRK peace, prosperity and well-being.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Kenya
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Kenya
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Uhuru Kenyatta, president of Kenya, on Sept. 9.
					 The president in his message extended the sincerest congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of Kenya and on his own behalf on the occasion of the national day of the DPRK.
					
					 The message expressed hope that fresh motive power would be provided in the DPRK to achieve greater prosperity and development on the significant 65th anniversary of its sovereignty.
					
					 Expressing belief that the bilateral friendly relations would grow stronger on the occasion, the message noted that Kenya is joining the Korean people in celebrating the significant holiday.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and the people of the DPRK greater success, development and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Cambodian King
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on September 5.
					 The king in the message said that he was pleased to send the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the Cambodian people and the royal government and on his own behalf on the occasion of the national holiday of the DPRK.
					
					 He wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Un happiness and greater success in the work for accomplishing the noble cause of leading the Korean people.
					
					 The DPRK is making sustained efforts to protect peace and achieve development and modernization under the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Un, he said, and continued:
					
					 The Kingdom of Cambodia will exert its efforts for boosting the excellent relations of friendship, solidarity and cooperation between the two countries and their peoples.
					
					 He paid the highest regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from President of Sri Lanka
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, received a message of greeting from Mahinda Rajapaksa, president of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, on September 9.
					 The president extended sincere regards and felicitations to Kim Jong Un, the DPRK government and its people on behalf of the government and people of Sri Lanka on the happy occasion of marking the anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed his conviction that the warm and friendly relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger on the principle of mutual benefits in the future.
					
					 He said he availed himself of the opportunity to sincerely wish Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Congolese President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Greetings from Congolese President
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, received a message of greeting from Denis Sassou Nguesso, president of the Republic of Congo, on September 6.
					 The president in the message extended his warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people and government of Congo and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK and wished him happiness in good health and the Korean people prosperity.
					
					 He reaffirmed his will to make efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Pays Floral Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Red Cross Society of China headed by its Executive Vice-President Zhao Baige Thursday visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill to pay tribute to them.
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them in boundless reverence for the peerlessly great men.

articles.title: Delegation of Thai Foreign Ministry Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of Thai Foreign Ministry Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Thailand led by Damrong Kraikruan, director-general of the Department of East Asian Affairs, visited Mangyongdae on Sept. 19.
					 The delegation looked round President Kim Il Sung's birthplace where historical relics are preserved with great care, being briefed on the home of historic significance.
					
					 It also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the KPA Museum of Weapons and Equipment, etc.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Opt for Settling Its Past
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Opt for Settling Its Past
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The future of Japan depends on opting to settle its past as soon as possible instead of seeking to become a military giant.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in an article.
					
					 Citing facts to prove the hair-raising atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean people in the past, it goes on:
					
					 If one committed a crime, one should make an apology and reparation for it. The same is the case with the relations between the states.
					
					 It is the unavoidable state responsibility and the political and moral obligation for a war criminal state to make an apology and reparation to the victim either in view of international law or in ethical and moral points of view.
					
					 It is already 68 years since the defeat of the Japanese imperialists but Japan is rapidly veering to the Right and desperately pursuing militarism, still denying its crime-woven history.
					
					 Its ulterior intention is to repeat its past history of aggression and crimes by stepping up the moves to become a military power.
					
					 Japan remains unchanged in its nature. It has emerged as a dangerous force threatening the global peace.
					
					 The world is following Japan's behaviors with heightened vigilance.

articles.title: Conservative Media Condemned in S. Korea
articles.content:
Conservative Media Condemned in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Eight south Korean media organizations including the Press Trade Union and the Citizens Federation for Democratic Press held a press conference outside the building of the Choson Ilbo on Sept. 16 at which they condemned the conservative media for launching a smear campaign.
					 At the press conference the speakers accused the Choson Ilbo of taking the lead in the political dealings of the present "government" to hinder the investigation into the Intelligence Service's case.
					
					 The regime is plotting to hamper the progress in the investigation as the true colors of the case is being brought to light with each passing day and the Choson Ilbo is chiming in with this, building up false public opinion, the speakers held, adding:
					
					 The media is describing the candlelight actions waged by broad range of masses as a political scramble between the ruling party and opposition parties, and the standoff between the conservative and progressive organizations, distorting the truth.
					
					 This shows that the Choson Ilbo is not following through on its primary mission as the media and this makes it extremely difficult for it to be called media but part of the conservative forces.
					
					 The Chongwadae, IS and the Choson Ilbo are coordinating their efforts to cover up the IS's case.
					
					 The speakers declared that they would stand up against the conservative media through the campaign of boycotting the paper in solidarity with the democratic forces of various circles.

articles.title: S. Korean IS's Crackdown on Political Party Censured
articles.content:
S. Korean IS's Crackdown on Political Party Censured 
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The puppet Intelligence Service (IS) Tuesday mounted another round of harsh crackdown upon the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) under the pretext of the investigation into the plotted rebellion, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 That day the Kyonggi branch of the IS searched houses and offices of five relevant members including the UPP spokesman.
					
					 The puppet group acted so rudely as to frisk them to find out the so-called evidence.
					
					 The UPP strongly protested this, saying the authorities were cracking down them to evade its responsibility for generating the political conflict.

articles.title: 65th Birthday of DPRK Observed Abroad
articles.content:
65th Birthday of DPRK Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Meetings for celebrating the 65th anniversary of the DPRK took place in Russia, Benin and Bulgaria on September 3 and 5.
					 Present there were personages of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Russian Women's Union, the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia, the Socialist Party of Benin, the Bulgarian Communists Union, the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, the Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia and masses.
					
					 The first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation said that the socialist cause of Korea pioneered by President Kim Il Sung and victoriously advanced by General Secretary Kim Jong Il is being creditably carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The first secretary noted that the DPRK fully demonstrated its dignity and might on the international arena for 65 years since its founding, adding that this was the precious fruition of the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The president of the Socialist Party of Benin said that since the proclamation of its founding on September 9, 1948 the DPRK has traversed the road of victory and glory for 65 years.
					
					 The president went on:
					
					 The DPRK has consistently stood for the building of a socialist state centered on the popular masses.
					
					 The DPRK established the socialist system and instituted the socialist constitution and has consistently orientated all lines and policies and activities of the state to protecting the independent rights and interests of the people.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Benin and Bulgaria.

articles.title: DPRK's Successes Praised by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
DPRK's Successes Praised by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Lectures were given in France, Sweden, Guinea and Zimbabwe between September 2 and 9.
					
					 The vice-president of the France-Korea Friendship Association paid highest tribute to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il who made great contributions to the founding of the DPRK and its development.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The DPRK has registered shining achievements in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It has coped with all pressures and military threats of the imperialists including the U.S. from its peace-loving stand backed by powerful military muscle, thereby firmly defending its sovereignty and dignity and peace and security on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 We will launch widespread activities for supporting the just cause of the Korean people.
					
					 The chief of the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said in his lecture:
					
					 The DPRK has strictly orientated all lines and policies and activities of the state to protecting the independent rights and interests of the people and enforced all popular policies, thus consistently standing for the building of a unique socialist state centred on the popular masses.
					
					 The DPRK remained unfazed when socialism was frustrated in different countries, and ushered in a new era of building a thriving nation, holding high the banner of socialism even in the worst adversity in which the offensive of the imperialist allied forces to stifle it got undisguised and unprecedentedly severe natural calamities hit the country for several consecutive years.
					
					 The Korean people are now bringing about miracles and innovations every day in every field of socialist construction in the spirit of the "speed on Masik Pass."

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed by Foreign Papers
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Papers of different countries carried special write-ups from September 5 to 11 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Russian paper Chelyabinsk Komsomolskaya Pravda allotted one whole page to an article titled "DPRK, an independent country" illustrated with a photo documenting revolutionary activities of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper introduced in detail the history of the DPRK in which it has brought about shining victories and gigantic changes under the leadership of the great leader and party.
					
					 The Kuwaiti paper Al-Anba carried an article titled "Impregnable state demonstrating its existence" illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un inspecting a unit of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 September 9 marks the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The founding of the DPRK was a historic event, which brought about a dramatic turn in carving out the destiny of the Korean people.
					
					 The DPRK is now striving hard to attain the goal of a powerful country in all fields including economy, science and technology and sports, while further consolidating its status as political, ideological and military power.
					
					 The Lebanese paper Al Diyar carried an article illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un standing in the tribute of honor at Kim Il Sung Square.
					
					 The Egyptian paper Al－Misaiya, the Thai paper Xing San Daily and the Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times carried articles under the respective headlines "Invincible power" and "65 years of victory and glory," etc.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Celebrated in Different Countries 
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Film Shows took place in Russia, Cuba, Guinea, DR Congo and Indonesia between September 2 and 13 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Participants of the film shows watched "Pyongyang today", "Fireworks of a thriving nation", "Wolmi Island" and other Korean films.
					
					 The principal of the 11th Middle School in Khabarovsk City, Russia in a speech warmly congratulated the Korean people on the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. The speaker went on:
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is now energetically leading the DPRK which was founded and glorified by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people are working world-startling miracles in several fields including politics, economy, military and culture.
					
					 The director of the Almami Samori Toure Barracks Training Centre of the Guinean army said that the national power of the DPRK reached the highest level thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The national power of the DPRK reached space thanks to its successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2.
					
					 It is something great that the DPRK, not a big country, emerged as a space power in the world.
					
					 Such a stirring reality in the DPRK would be unthinkable without the leadership of Kim Jong Un possessed of matchless grit and experienced political caliber.
					
					 A director of an Indonesian company sincerely wished the Korean people led by Kim Jong Un greater success in building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed by DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed by DPRK Missions Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- Events took place in DPRK missions abroad on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 There were receptions, round-table talks, book and photo exhibitions and film shows at the DPRK missions in Beijing, Shenyang and Hong Kong in China, Moscow, Khabarovsk and Nakhodka in Russia, Cuba, Vietnam, Iran, Cambodia, Laos, India, Nepal, Myanmar, Thailand, Singapore, Uzbekistan, Romania, Sweden, Brazil, Egypt, Guinea, South Africa and Uganda between September 3 and 8.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos showing the exploits President Kim Il Sung performed in the nation-building and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the Songun revolution and the revolutionary activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 On display there were books including works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and photos showing the history of the DPRK and the efforts made by the Korean people in building a thriving nation.
					
					 Participants of the film shows watched "Fireworks of a thriving nation", "Pyongyang today" and "Tower of the Juche Idea" and other Korean films.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Liaoning Provincial People’s Political Consultative Conference of China said that after its founding the DPRK vigorously advanced along the road of progress and development under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the National Council of the Vietnamese National Assembly sincerely congratulated the Korean people on the shining successes made over the last 65 years.
					
					 A vice foreign minister of Iran noted that Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were the great statesmen who performed immortal feats  in making the DPRK rich, powerful and prosperous.
					
					 The prime minister of the Yangon Regional Government of Myanmar said that the DPRK turned into a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence, thanks to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, adding tremendous is the might of the people of the DPRK single-mindedly united around Kim Jong Un and no force on earth can match it.
					
					 The director for East Asia of the Brazilian Foreign Ministry wished the Korean people success in their drive for building an economic power and protecting peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Korea's Historical Relics Introduced by Chinese Paper
articles.content:
Korea's Historical Relics Introduced by Chinese Paper
 Pyongyang, September 19 (KCNA) -- The Chinese paper Huan Qiu Shibao on September 11 introduced historical relics in Kaesong City under the title of "Historical monuments in Kaesong boast 500 year- long prosperity."
					 The paper said that a lot of historical sites and relics are preserved as they are in Kaesong which has a long history as a capital of Koryo dynasty (918-1392), the first unified state of the Korean nation, which existed for nearly 500 years.
					
					 It dealt with the fact that the twelve historical sites in Kaesong City of the DPRK were registered as world cultural heritage sites at the 37th meeting of the World Heritage Committee of the UNESCO held in June this year.
					
					 Introducing in detail the registered historical sites including the Mausoleum of King Wang Gon (first reign), the Mausoleum of King Kongmin (thirty first reign), Koryo Songgyungwan University and Manwoldae, it said that they are frequented by  tourists of different countries as they bear witness to the national culture and its advantages in the period of Koryo dynasty.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un firma cartas enviadas por habitantes de varias unidades
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un firma cartas enviadas por habitantes de varias unidades
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dejo autografos en las cartas enviadas por los funcionarios, trabajadores, profesores, empleados y escolares de distintas unidades reflejando sus voluntades de seguir invariablemente al partido  guardando el amor y la confianza de los grandes hombres sin pares del monte Paektu.
					Lo hizo en la carta escrita por los profesores, empleados y estudiantes de la Universidad de Seguridad del Pueblo Kim Jong Il, que levantaron en su recinto la estatua de bronce del Generalisimo Kim Jong Il con motivo del 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					Firmo tambien las cartas enviadas por los empleados del Complejo Quimico Juventud de Hamhung, los miembros del grupo artistico del distrito Changsong de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, los funcionarios y empleados del Acuario de Delfines de Rungna, los militantes de celula del Comite del PTC en la brigada de produccion no.1 de la Fabrica de Neumaticos de Taesong de Pyongyang, los jugadores y entrenadores del equipo A del grupo de futbol Hwaebul del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung, los jugadores y entrenadores participantes en el futbol femenino de la Copa de Asia Oriental 2013, Jang Un Bi, tractorista de la brigada de mecanizacion de la Granja Cooperativa de Hungso del distrito de Hamju de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, Yu Pyol Mi quien estudia en la escuela central de musica adscrita al Conservatorio Estatal de Moscu Chaikovski y Kim Yu Jin, alumno de la Escuela de Lenguas Extranjeras de Nampho.

articles.title: Rinden homenaje a martires con motivo de Chusok
articles.content:
Rinden homenaje a martires con motivo de Chusok
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 15 de agosto lunar (fiesta folclorica), fueron depositadas este jueves las ofrendas florales ante el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del Monte Taesong,  el de Martires Patrioticos y el de Martires de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					En los cementerios estaban colocadas las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					En las ceremonias de homenaje estuvieron presentes Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, los viceprimeros ministros del Consejo de Ministros, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios de organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, las entidades sociales, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea y trabajadores capitalinos. 
					
					Fueron colocadas en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Daesong  las ofrendas florales a nombre del Comite Central del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea; en el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos la ofrenda floral en nombre comun del CC del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC; y en el Cementerio de Martires de Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria la otra en nombre comun del CC y la Comision Militar Central del PTC y del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC.
					
					Tambien fueron puestas las otras a nombre de los organismos de las fuerzas armadas, entidades sociales, ministerios, organos  centrales, unidades del EPC, instituciones de educacion, salud publica, prensa e informacion y los organismos del partido y el poder, empresas y granjas en esta capital. 
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires quienes fueron infinitamente fieles a la guia del Presidente Kim Il Sung y del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y sacrificaron sus preciosas vidas en la lucha por la liberacion y prosperidad de la patria y el cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Juche. 
					
					Este dia, tuvieron lugar los actos similares ante las estatuas de bronce, cementerios, monumentos y tumbas de los martires en Hyesan, Wonsan, Chongjin, Haeju y otras localidades.

articles.title: Colocadas ofrendas florales ante tumbas de Kim Po Hyon, Ri Po Ik, Kim Hyong Jik y Kang Pan Sok

					Alli estaban colocadas las ofrendas florales enviados por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					En la ceremonia de homenaje estuvieron presentes Kim Yong Nam, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Kim Yang Gon, Mun Kyong Dok, Jo Yon Jun, los funcionarios de organismos del partido y el poder, entidades de masas, ministerios y organos centrales y trabajadores capitalinos. 
					
					Fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales a nombre del Comite Central del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC, y las otras a nombre de las entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, instituciones de educacion, organismos del partido, el poder y granjas en esta capital. 
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio recordando la vida revolucionaria de aquellos fervientes patriotas.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia disparates anti-RPDC de Kim Kwan Jin
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia disparates anti-RPDC de Kim Kwan Jin
Pyongyang, 19 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En la "reunion informativa de la politica de defensa" sesionada el dia 15 en Inchon, el traidor Kim Kwan Jin, ministro de Defensa Nacional del Sur de Corea, dijo que "en confabulacion con las fuerzas seguidoras al Norte de Corea, este prepara la guerra de 4a generacion consistente en crear disturbio social mediante la guerra cibernetica, la campana mediatica y el terrorismo". Y cito como uno de los preparativos de esa guerra el incidente de conspiracion para una rebelion por parte del Partido Progresista Unido, el cual fue inventado por la misma banda de conservadores surcoreanos.
					Al censurar ademas las medidas protagonicas de la RPDC tomadas para mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas, las califico de "ofensiva de dialogo tactico para salir del atolladero".
					
					Con anterioridad, durante la reunion plenaria del comite de defensa nacional de la Asamblea Nacional, la reunion de comandantes de todo el ejercito y el "simposio militar internacional de Seul", chismeo que "no se puede tolerar las armas nucleares del Norte", "hay antecedentes de que el Norte cometio acto provocador tambien en el tiempo de conversaciones" y el "Norte no podra ganar nada con armas nucleares, misiles y amenazas de provocacion".
					
					En su informacion no. 1041 publicada la vispera, el Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria condeno esos dichos del traidor Kim Kwan Jin como chismografia anacronica que contraviene a la corriente de la epoca actual a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas y al alivio de tension.
					
					Ademas, constituyen una burla intolerable y desafio imperdonable a la RPDC que se esfuerza en todo lo posible por la reconciliacion y la reunificacion de la nacion, recalca el documento y prosigue:
					
					Kim es vendepatria proyanqui y gangster belicoso que siendo ejecutor material de la estrategia de Estados Unidos de dominar Asia y de la politica conflictiva anti-RPDC de la banda de conservadores, llevo a la ruptura las relaciones intercoreanas y creo la peor crisis de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Descontento de la apertura de nueva coyuntura de dialogo en las relaciones intercoreanas, el pronuncia estos dias las palabras provocativas anti-RPDC para revertir a la tension y enfrentamiento la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana que entro en el proceso de distension.
					
					La realidad deja conocer claramente que jamas se mejoraran las relaciones N-S conforme a la esperanza de la nacion y se agravara mas la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana, si se dejan intactos a los fanaticos de enfrentamiento como Kim.
					
					Sin embargo, las actuales autoridades surcoreanas hablan del "proceso de confianza de la Peninsula Coreana" amparando por otra parte a los traidores como Kim Kwan Jin, que censura la buena fe, generosidad y voluntad de dialogo y paz de la connacional RPDC, lo cual es un fraude y engano para enganar al pueblo y la opinion publica.
					
					Cuando las autoridades surcoreanas ratificaron a ese traidor como ministro de Defensa Nacional, la RPDC ya ha advertido que toda la nacion coreana sufrira desgracias.
					
					Hay que eliminar cuanto antes a las basuras de la epoca como Kim para el nuevo desarrollo de relaciones intercoreanas, la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					La RPDC se esforzara en todo lo posible por el mejoramiento de las relaciones Norte-Sur y la reconciliacion y la reunificacion de la nacion, pero no perdonara nunca a la horda de traidores que actua provocativamente burlandose de la dignidad de la RPDC.
					
					Los que desafian a la corriente de la epoca seran condenados severamente por la nacion.
